millsfield:images_texts:
ELECTRA
NATIONAL AIRLINES EMERGENCY INSTRUCTIONS
SAFETY IS OUR FIRST
CONSIDERATION
We want you to know about
the various safety features on
this airplane. The stewardess
will advise during the pre-
departure announcement the
type of aircraft you are aboard,
whether it is a Boeing 727,
Douglas DC-8, Super DC-8,
or Lockheed Electra II. After
you review the EMERGENCY
INSTRUCTIONS on Pages 2
through 8, turn to the section
pertaining to the aircraft type
for specific instructions on the
operation and location of
EMERGENCY EXITS and
CABIN DOORS. OPERA-
TION of EVACUATION
SLIDES, and OPERATION of
the OXYGEN SYSTEM which
are applicable to the aircraft
you are aboard.
Government regulations require that
instructions explaining the proced
ures for Emergencies be provided
for the information of the passengers.
PLEASE DO NOT REMOVE THIS BOOKLET FROM THE AIRCRAFT

NATIONAL AIRLINES
Government Regulations require that instructions explaining the procedures
for emergencies be provided for the information of passengers.
2002.127.425
